required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study to Define the ECG Effects of Tizanidine Compared to Placebo and the Positive Control, Moxifloxacin, in Healthy Men and Women Using a Blinded ECG Evaluator: A Thorough ECG Trial
clinical_study.official_title: A Partial-Blind, Randomized, Parallel Design Study With a Nested Crossover Comparison to Define the ECG Effects of Tizanidine Compared to Placebo and the Positive Control, Moxifloxacin, in Healthy Men and Women Using a Blinded ECG Evaluator: A Thorough ECG Trial

brief_summary.textblock: This is a single-center, partial-blind, randomized, placebo-controlled, parallel design study with a nested crossover comparison to define the ECG effects of tizanidine compared to placebo and the positive control, moxifloxacin, in healthy men and women. The study will be conducted in a Phase 1 unit with sufficient facilities to house subjects as required by the protocol.

study_design_info.masking: Quadruple (Participant, Care Provider, Investigator, Outcomes Assessor)

primary_outcome.measure: The Primary Endpoint Will be the Baseline-adjusted, Placebo-corrected Effect on QTc (ΔΔQTc) on Day 14.
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval) at Day 14 (Tizanidine 24 mg). Moxifloxacin was not investigational drug, it was used to assess the sensitivity of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: The Baseline-adjusted, Placebo-corrected (ΔΔQTc) on QTc Method Not Selected as Primary Endpoint.
secondary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval) at Day 5 (Tizanidine 8 mg). Moxifloxacin was not investigational drug, it was used to assess the sensitivity of the study.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessing the Relationship Between Changes in the QTc Interval and Plasma Levels of Tizanidine Using Concentration-effect Modeling
secondary_outcome.description: The relationship will be quantified using a linear mixed effects model with an intercept. Data from Day 5 and Day 14 were fitted into regression model to obtain a slope of change. The measure type 'Number' followed by (90% Confidence Interval) shown in results is the slope from the linear fit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximum Plasma Concentration (Cmax) of Single Doses of 8 and 24 mg Tizanidine After Reaching Steady State.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12 & 24 hours post dose on Days 5 (8 mg) and 14 (24 mg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Reach Maximum Plasma Concentration (Tmax) of Single Doses of 8 and 24 mg Tizanidine After Reaching Steady State.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12 & 24 hours post dose on Days 5 (8 mg) and 14 (24 mg)

secondary_outcome.measure: Area Under the Plasma Concentration-time Curve During a Dosing Interval (AUCt) of Single Doses of 8 and 24 mg Tizanidine After Reaching Steady State.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 0.5, 1, 1.5, 2, 4, 8, 12 & 24 hours post dose on Days 5 (8 mg) and 14 (24 mg)

arm_group.description: Oral dose of 2 and 4 milligram (mg) tablets
Placebo followed by a single dose 400 mg moxifloxacin tablets.
Single dose of 400 mg moxifloxacin followed by placebo.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Women of childbearing potential should have a negative urine pregnancy test prior to Screening and Day -2 of the trial
- All subjects of childbearing potential must practice a highly effective method of birth control excluding oral contraceptives for the duration of the trial and up to 3 months after the last dose of investigational product. Oral contraceptives are not allowed, based on the precaution listed in the Zanaflex package insert.
- Have a body mass index (BMI) ranging between 19 and 30 kg/m2
- Comprehend and be able to provide written informed consent
- Be willing and able to comply with all trial requirements
Exclusion Criteria:
- Female who is either pregnant, breastfeeding or planning to become pregnant
- History of hypersensitivity or allergic reaction to tizanidine or moxifloxacin or any of the tablet components
- Any condition possibly affecting drug absorption, metabolism or excretion including previous surgery for removal of parts of stomach, bowel, liver, gall bladder, or pancreas
- History of Long QT Syndrome or a first-generation relative with this condition
- Evidence or history of clinically significant allergies except for untreated, asymptomatic, seasonal allergies at time of dosing, hematological, endocrine, pulmonary, gastrointestinal, cardiovascular, hepatic, renal, psychiatric, or neurological disease. Determination of clinical significance is to be made at the Investigator's discretion
- History or presence of any malignant or benign neoplasm considered by the investigator to be clinically significant
- History of drug or alcohol abuse or dependence within the last year
- Have an active infectious disease

group.title: Initial Placebo and Crossover to Moxifloxacin
group.description: Dosing of moxifloxacin will only be analyzed for cause (if the effect of moxifloxacin is not as expected).

group.title: Initial Moxifloxacin and Crossover to Placebo
group.description: Dosing of moxifloxacin will only be analyzed for cause (if the effect of moxifloxacin is not as expected).

group.title: Initial Placebo and Crossover to Moxifloxacin
group.description: Dosing of moxifloxacin will only be analyzed for cause (if the effect of moxifloxacin is not as expected).

group.title: Initial Moxifloxacin and Crossover to Placebo
group.description: Dosing of moxifloxacin will only be analyzed for cause (if the effect of moxifloxacin is not as expected).

outcome.title: The Primary Endpoint Will be the Baseline-adjusted, Placebo-corrected Effect on QTc (ΔΔQTc) on Day 14.
outcome.description: Change from baseline in Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval) at Day 14 (Tizanidine 24 mg). Moxifloxacin was not investigational drug, it was used to assess the sensitivity of the study.
outcome.population: QT/QTc Analysis set: Received at least 1 dose of study drug (including placebo), had measurements at baseline and on-treatment with at least 1 time point post-dose with at minimum triplicate measures giving rise to a QTc value for primary correction method. Effect of moxifloxacin was as expected. Therefore, no analysis required per Medical Monitor.

group.title: Tizanidine Placebo 24 mg
group.description: 61 subjects placebo used for the analysis.

group.title: Tizanidine 24 mg Placebo-corrected
group.description: 60 subjects Tizanidine 24 mg single dose, 61 subjects placebo used for the analysis.

measure.title: The Primary Endpoint Will be the Baseline-adjusted, Placebo-corrected Effect on QTc (ΔΔQTc) on Day 14.
measure.description: Change from baseline in Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval) at Day 14 (Tizanidine 24 mg). Moxifloxacin was not investigational drug, it was used to assess the sensitivity of the study.
measure.population: QT/QTc Analysis set: Received at least 1 dose of study drug (including placebo), had measurements at baseline and on-treatment with at least 1 time point post-dose with at minimum triplicate measures giving rise to a QTc value for primary correction method. Effect of moxifloxacin was as expected. Therefore, no analysis required per Medical Monitor.

outcome.title: The Baseline-adjusted, Placebo-corrected (ΔΔQTc) on QTc Method Not Selected as Primary Endpoint.
outcome.description: Change from baseline in Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval) at Day 5 (Tizanidine 8 mg). Moxifloxacin was not investigational drug, it was used to assess the sensitivity of the study.
outcome.population: QT/QTc Analysis set: Received at least 1 dose of study drug (including placebo), had measurements at baseline and on-treatment with at least 1 time point post-dose with at minimum triplicate measures giving rise to a QTc value for primary correction method. Effect of moxifloxacin was as expected. Therefore, no analysis required per Medical Monitor.

group.title: Tizanidine 8 mg Placebo-corrected
group.description: 70 subjects Tizanidine 8 mg single dose, 63 subjects placebo used for analysis.

measure.title: The Baseline-adjusted, Placebo-corrected (ΔΔQTc) on QTc Method Not Selected as Primary Endpoint.
measure.description: Change from baseline in Cardiac Repolarization (QTc Interval) at Day 5 (Tizanidine 8 mg). Moxifloxacin was not investigational drug, it was used to assess the sensitivity of the study.
measure.population: QT/QTc Analysis set: Received at least 1 dose of study drug (including placebo), had measurements at baseline and on-treatment with at least 1 time point post-dose with at minimum triplicate measures giving rise to a QTc value for primary correction method. Effect of moxifloxacin was as expected. Therefore, no analysis required per Medical Monitor.

outcome.title: Assessing the Relationship Between Changes in the QTc Interval and Plasma Levels of Tizanidine Using Concentration-effect Modeling
outcome.description: The relationship will be quantified using a linear mixed effects model with an intercept. Data from Day 5 and Day 14 were fitted into regression model to obtain a slope of change. The measure type 'Number' followed by (90% Confidence Interval) shown in results is the slope from the linear fit.
outcome.population: Pk/QTc Analysis set will include all subjects in the QT/QTc analysis set with at least one valid PK assessment. Effect of moxifloxacin was as expected. Therefore, no analysis required per Medical Monitor.

measure.title: Assessing the Relationship Between Changes in the QTc Interval and Plasma Levels of Tizanidine Using Concentration-effect Modeling
measure.description: The relationship will be quantified using a linear mixed effects model with an intercept. Data from Day 5 and Day 14 were fitted into regression model to obtain a slope of change. The measure type 'Number' followed by (90% Confidence Interval) shown in results is the slope from the linear fit.
measure.population: Pk/QTc Analysis set will include all subjects in the QT/QTc analysis set with at least one valid PK assessment. Effect of moxifloxacin was as expected. Therefore, no analysis required per Medical Monitor.

outcome.population: PK Analysis set: all subjects from Group 1 who received at least one study drug and have at least one valid PK assessment

event.sub_title: GENERAL DISORDERS AND ADMINISTRATION SITE CONDITIONS

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Sponsor (Acorda) has right to review and comment on proposed publications within a specified time frame, up to 60 days; multi-center trials require joint publication unless specifically permitted otherwise.
